newsitem.title: USA: Clinton okays U.S. Enrichment Corp privatization.
newsitem.headline: Clinton okays U.S. Enrichment Corp privatization.

text.p: President Clinton on Friday approved a plan to privatize the U.S. Enrichment Corp, a government-owned corporation that produces enriched uranium for use as commercial nuclear reactor fuel.
USEC, which was formed in 1992, has utility customers in 14 countries and is based in Bethesda, Md. Its operations involve about 5,000 people.

The U.S. government -- following USEC's privatization -- will continue to monitor the company's activities that involve national security interests, including its role in converting highly-enriched uranium from Russian nuclear weapons into civilian reactor fuel.
Over the next several months the company will meet with the Treasury Department and other agencies to design and implement the final privatization transaction.
